trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The savvy stable master's herd is missing an alpaca or two.
TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_TODO_00<tab>/soothe the absconding alpacas.
TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_TODO_01<tab>Speak with the savvy stable master.

TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_PERUPERU05027_000_001<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, isn't it? I've heard all about your affinity with the alpacas! My cousin works on the ranch at Wachunpelo─he was practically gushing.

TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_PERUPERU05027_000_002<tab>As it so happens, I have need of your talents. Some of the herd escaped during the attack on the city the other day. I managed to round most of them up, but we're still two short.

TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_PERUPERU05027_000_003<tab>They haven't been seen leaving via the gates, so I think it's safe to assume they're hiding somewhere within the city walls. So, how about it? Can I ask you to round up those last two stragglers?
TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_PERUPERU05027_000_004<tab>Thank you! Oh, and I'm sure I don't need to tell you, but despite being trained as mounts, alpacas are easily rattled.

TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_PERUPERU05027_000_005<tab>If you come across our stragglers, make sure you <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>soothe<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> them first. Got that? No sudden movements!

TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_PERUPERU05027_000_006<tab>The two missing alpacas should be here in the city. Try and find them! And remember to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>soothe<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> them before you even think of making your approach!
TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_ALPACA05027_000_010<tab>Hrrrmmm! Spatchoo!

TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_SYSTEM_000_011<tab>In your haste, you find yourself on the receiving end of a glistening gob of alpaca spit. Be sure to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>soothe<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> the animal before you approach.
TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_ALPACA05027_000_012<tab>Mrrrmm, hrrmmm.
TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_SYSTEM_000_013<tab>The suitably soothed animal makes its way nonchalantly back to the alpaca stables.
TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_PERUPERU05027_000_020<tab>Thank you! The two stragglers arrived safe and sound a little while ago.
TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_PERUPERU05027_000_021<tab>A masterful display of alpaca husbandry! No wonder you were asked to play a part in the rite of succession!

TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_PERUPERU05027_000_022<tab><sniff> I recognize that smell! Let me guess, you ignored my advice and got rewarded with a faceful of alpaca spit? I hope you've learned your lesson... That stink'll be with you for a few days yet!
TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_PERUPERU05027_000_023<tab>These alpacas are direct descendants of the mounts we Pelupelu presented as a sign of friendship when Tuliyollal was founded.

TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_PERUPERU05027_000_024<tab>I'm sure you've heard the tale of Gulool Ja Ja catching a golden alpaca? Well, the creatures we gifted were sired by that shiny beast itself. To say they had quite the pedigree would be a gross undervaluation!

TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_PERUPERU05027_000_025<tab>And you can be sure that their legacy survives today: these beasts are fleet of foot and strong of limb, just like their ancestors. If you ever have need of a mount, you could do far worse than a Tuliyollal alpaca!
TEXT_KINGZA011_05027_PERUPERU05027_000_026<tab>Right, I should tend to the two that you so kindly brought back. I appreciate all the help!
